title.narrative: Vietnam - Government Debt Issuance and Management

description.narrative: This GDIM intermittent project is working with the Ministry of Finance's Debt Management Office (DMO) to consolidate existing domestic issuers of government guaranteed debt within the DMO's operations. Additional assistance supports the development of a MOF debt issuance strategy that addresses increased demand for shorter maturities, the creation an efficient price discovery mechanism for Treasury Bills, the development of a trade reporting system, reforms to the primary dealer system including dealer selection and performance monitoring, development of a technical methodology to quantify liability portfolio risks, and building DMO staff capacity to conduct all facets of debt issuance and management responsibilities.. Broader, deeper primary and secondary markets for central government and sub-sovereign debt obligations. Complete understanding by government and regulatory officials of relationionship of primary and secondary markets for government securities.Safem efficient registry, depository , and settlement systems that support greater transaction volumes. Adoption of market-based government securities distribution and trading practices, and standardization of domestic debt instruments. Improved communications between national and sub-sovereign government issuers, market intermediaries, and investors.

description.narrative: U.S. assistance will support governance reforms that broaden economic participation, make growth more sustainable, improve labor conditions, facilitate engagement by the private sector and civil society, promote respect for human rights and the rule of law, and expand accountability and transparency. U.S. assistance will help the government address climate change and remediation of contaminated sites, promote biodiversity conservation, combat HIV/AIDS, and make significant investments in higher education and health to improve the livelihoods and well-being of vulnerable groups, particularly persons with disabilities (PWDs). U.S. assistance will also promote regional stability and security by increasing bilateral military cooperation on maritime security, maritime law enforcement, border security, and counter-terrorism; addressing unexploded ordnance; and building capacity in the justice sector, law enforcement, counternarcotics, and nonproliferation of Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD).
